drupalNodeEvent.title: “Mutual Responsibility System: Can We Talk about Justice without Considering Individual Rights?”

field_speakers.processed: Prof. Liang Cai, Department of History, University of Notre Dame

field_organizers.processed: Lousi Frieberg Center for East Asian Studies, Hebrew University of Jerusalem Confucius Institute, and the Hebrew Univeristy Department of Asian Studeis

field_description.processed:
Abstract: 

Early Imperial China (221 BCE -9CE) formed the foundation of the legal system for two millennia of Chinese dynastic history. This talk will explore the philosophical conception of justice in lieu of the mutual responsibility system---a widely practiced principle that produced a large number of innocent convicts. It shall examine the way early Chinese thinkers, officials, and emperors perceived justice in general and legal justice in particular.
